abstract_summ: Compared to prior years, searches for sore and burning eyes increased and conjunctivitis search increases were variable based on language.Online search data was used to explore a connection between COVID-19 and ocular symptoms.The patient developed a severe macrophage activation syndrome diagnosed by bone marrow biopsy, which did not respond to immunoglobulin therapy.This case highlights management strategies including the use of corticosteroids, an IL-6 inhibitor, and an aldose reductase inhibitor resulting in complete clinical recovery.Abstract: We describe the case of a critically-ill patient with myocarditis and severe ARDS related to COVID-19 infection.
title_summ: A Recovered Case of COVID-19 Myocarditis and ARDS Treated with Corticosteroids, Tocilizumab, and Experimental AT-001Correction to: New clinical manifestation of COVID-19 related Guillain-Barrè syndrome highly responsive to intravenous immunoglobulins: two Italian casesHemophagocytic syndrome and COVID-19Ocular Signs of COVID-19 Suggested by Internet Search Term Patterns Worldwide.
